column1: The '''Guest-elves''' were a branch of the [[Green-elves]] of [[Ossiriand]].

column2: Denethor]], leader of the [[Green-elves]], was killed by [[Orcs]] on [[Amon Ereb]] in the [[First Battle of Beleriand]], some of the [[Green-elves
column3: Laiquendi]] fled westward to [[Doriath]] and settled in [[Arthórien]]. These became known as the Guest-elves.<ref name=WJP1>{{WJ

column1: The Guest-elves had their own chief (of whom [[Saeros]] was the son), and they had a permanent place in the council of [[Thingol]]. However, some of the Guest-elves were "darkhearted", and they did not "mingle happily with the Teleri of Doriath".<ref name=WJP1/> Neither were they friends to the [[Edain]] of [[Estolad]]—the [[Men
column2: mannish]] region situated just east of Arthórien, into which the Guest-elves often wandered by crossing the River [[Celon]].<ref name=UT>{{UT
